page.title: 01Tourism. Town of Chepstow
page.content: Welsh name Cas Gwent Population = 13,400 Earliest known name Estrighoiel (as entered in the original Domesday Book) Chepstow has easy access to both the M4 and M5 motorways. { The town is built on the side of a hill with a rather steep slope from the west or right bank of the River Wye near its confluence with the Severn. The tides are peculiar here and sometimes rise as high as 50 feet:the average is 38 feet but a rise of about 70 feet has been recorded. A new leisure centre has recently been built along with a new school,which is extended to the comprehensive,instead of a separate school.Chepstow also has a castle and a church built in the 12th century.It also has a Medieval town arch.Chepstow is worth visiting.}
